div.p: CodeSystem "Recruitment Materials": This is a code system for ...
This code system defines all codes needed for ... :

description.value: Code System providing a list of Study recruitment material categories and items.

definition.value: Broadcasting is the distribution of audio or video content to a dispersed audience via any electronic mass communications medium, but typically one using the electromagnetic spectrum (radio waves), in a one-to-many model.
A form of waveform distortion.
A part of a longer recording.
A transmission and reception of electromagnetic waves, especially those carrying sound messages.
Printed matter was produced by printers or publishers, such as books, magazines, booklets, brochures and other publicity materials and in some cases, newspapers.
A periodical publication containing articles and illustrations.
A printed publication (usually issued daily or weekly) consisting of folded unstapled sheets and containing news, feature articles and advertisements.
Is Issued periodically to the members of a society, business, or organization.
Is scholarly journal addressed to a particular professional audience such as doctors, teachers or engineers and published by a professional organization.
Is sending a message by mail without an envelope.

Social media are interactive computer-mediated technologies that facilitate the creation and sharing of information, ideas, career interests and other forms of expression via virtual communities and networks.
Is a computer-based technology that facilitates the sharing of ideas and information and the building of virtual networks and communities.
Is a series – it’s the entire show rather than any individual episode.
Is a written statement about a matter of public interest which is given to the press by an organization concerned with the matter.
Is an online platform that allows users to create a public profile and interact with other users on the website.
Is a form of advertising on the World Wide Web delivered by an ad server.
Something posted for public viewing or an electronic message sent to and displayed on an online forum.
An online advertising is an ad that may take many different forms. It could be a banner, a graphic image or an animated GIF of a designated pixel size and byte size.
A Website is a page or collection of pages on the World Wide Web that contains specific information which was all provided by one person, group or an organization.
Communication addressed to a specific person.
A public and typically formal statement about a fact, occurrence, or intention.
Involving someone's physical presence rather than communication by phone, email, etc.
A written, typed, or printed communication, especially one sent in an envelope by mail or messenger.
Letters and packages conveyed by the postal system.
A convenient, self-standing promotional unit created from printed and folded cardstock.
A Telephone Call to a radio station or a television station in which the caller participates in the on-going program.
A popular technique among social scientists who wish to work with a population that is difficult to identify or locate.
Communication addressed to more than one person.
An ad that may take many different forms. It could be a banner, a graphic image or an animated GIF of a designated pixel size and byte size.
A large outdoor advertising space designed to capture the attention of motorists and pedestrians.
A small book or magazine that contains images and information about a company or organization's products and/or services.
A place on a computer system where users can read messages and add their own .
Sometimes referred to as handbills, leaflets, inserts or circulars. Flyer is a small piece of paper with information on it about a product or event.
A large printed picture, photograph, or notice that you stick or pin to a wall or board, usually for decoration or to advertise something.
A publication that containing the latest information/tips/predictions for a particular business or stock market information or horse racing results, etc.
Communication addressed to the public.
Messages distributed by electronic means from one computer user to one or more recipients via a network.
